comment.author: 47079330@N03
comment._content: I am pretty sure that he must be Edward Robert BREDIN who crops up in many navy lists as on www.ancestry.co.uk see also www.hmswarrior.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/the%20vessel.htm

comment.author: 47079330@N03
comment._content: He married a daughter of the Rector of Wark upon Tyne, Northumberland, in 1923

comment.author: 47079330@N03
comment._content: I did a search of www.findmypast.co.uk as well and found a reference to him leaving the country by sea in 1960 (presumably going on holiday as the destination was the Canaries) Born 31 July 1883 in Ireland. In December 1960 he gave his occupation as Priest. Clerk in Holy Orders. Address Old Pottery Cottage, Brede, Rye, Sussex.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Death records show Edward Robert Bredin was born 31st July 1883. He died within the registration district of Hastings & Rother, Sussex in 1977.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Crockfords 1932 shows BA 1905, MA 1928. Parishes: Ballymoney 1906-07, St Mk Harrogate 1907-11, Chaplain RN HMS Forte 1911-12, HMS Yarmouth 1912-13, HMS Warrior 1913-16, HMS Bonaventure 1916-18, HMS Commonwealth 1918-19, Rector of Wark-on-Tyne 1919-26, Ulcombe, Diocese of Canterbury from 1926.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: He married Lucy Marian Ross-Lewin (b.1899 Hexham, d. 1959 Radnorshire) in 1923 at St Martin's, London.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Children born to the couple (Source FreeBMD): 
Bredin Rodney N R-L mother Ross-Lewin        Registration 1st qr 1928 Hollingbourn 2a 1492 
Bredin Robert E         mother  Ross-Lewin       Registration 3rd qr 1929 Maidstone   2a 1523
Bredin Robin W A mother  Ross-Lewin            Registration 3rd qr 1929 Maidstone   2a 1523
Bredin Terence P O mother  Ross-Lewin         Registration 3rd qr 1929 Maidstone   2a 1523

comment.author: 47079330@N03
comment._content: Best not to mention the children if born less than 100 years ago and therefore could still be alive.
